question: Which present-nation forms the successor state of the Khmer Empire?
explanation: The present-state of Cambodia is the successor state of the Khmer empire. Khmer Empire was also known as the Angkor Empire. It was a Hindu-Buddhist empire of Southeast Asia. It was in reign from 802 AD to 1431 AD. Jayavarman II was the founder of the empire, with Angkor as its capital. The Ayutthayan invasion of 1431 lead to the decline of the Khmer empire.
